George Burns, Gracie Allen, Martha Raye, Bob Hope, Edward Everett Horton, Florence George, Ben Blue, Betty Grable, Jackie Coogan, John Payne, Cecil Cunningham, Robert Cummings, Jerry Colonna. Directed by Raoul Walsh.

programme.title: Show People
programme.desc: A Georgia girl goes to Hollywood and becomes an actress in comedies. But when she's hired away by a snooty "high art" studio, the love she left behind from her comedy days becomes determined to get her back.

programme.title: Fatty and Mabel Adrift
programme.desc: A beachfront cottage belonging to a pair of newlyweds is pushed out to sea by one of the bride's spurned suitors.

programme.title: A Day at the Races
programme.desc: The Marx Brothers use their trademark crazy antics to convince a wealthy dowager to pay the delinquent mortgage on a sanitarium, with the help of a hard-luck race horse. (cc).

programme.title: Babes in the Goods
programme.desc: On their first day working in a department store, two gal pals get locked in overnight.

programme.title: Village of Daughters
programme.desc: Comedy about an itinerant English salesman who stops at a small town in Sicily, where he finds himself the object of affection for a bevy of young Italian beauties because all of the eligible males have left the island to look for work.

programme.title: Luxury Liner
programme.desc: A teenager becomes Cupid's assistant after she stows away on her father's "Love Boat"-type cruise ship, where she entertains passengers with songs while also finding herself falling for a young officer on the vessel. (cc).

programme.title: Unexpected Uncle
programme.desc: When a shopgirl (Anne Shirley) loses her job because of an overattentive customer (James Craig), a kindly stranger (Charles Coburn) rallies to her aid. Wilkins: Ernest Truex. Tommy: Russell Gleason. Carol West: Renee Haal. Sara Cochran: Astrid Allwyn. Pleasant romance. Peter Godfrey directed.

programme.title: The Courtship of Eddie's Father
programme.desc: A young son thinks it's about time for his widowed father to start dating again, but he's not happy about dad's choices in women. So the lad takes matters into his own hands and tries to fix up his father with the attractive next-door neighbor. The film spawned a popular TV series (1969-72). (cc).

programme.title: Wedding Rehearsal
programme.desc: Roland Young stars in this tale about a marquis who avoids marriage while playing Cupid to his bachelor friends. Bimbo: John Loder. Tottles: Maurice Evans. Mary-Rose: Wendy Barrie. Miss Hutchinson: Merle Oberon (her first important role). Rosemary: Joan Gardner. Lord Stokeshire: George Grossmith. Mrs. Dryden: Diana Napier. Alexander Korda directed.

programme.title: Tish
programme.desc: Three meddling spinsters in a small town unexpectedly "inherit" a baby and embark on a number of madcap parenting misadventures. (cc).

programme.title: Hurry, Charlie, Hurry
programme.desc: A henpecked husband (Leon Errol) who wants his daughter (Mildred Coles) to wed for love must battle his society-minded wife (Cecil Cunningham). Kenneth Howell. Morris: George Watts. Cardwell: Chester Clute. Directed by Charles E. Roberts.

programme.title: Make Way for a Lady
programme.desc: An impulsive teenager tries to play matchmaker between her widower-dad and a novelist, unaware that he has already fallen for one of her high-school teachers.

programme.title: Bachelor Bait
programme.desc: When a marriage-license clerk is fired, he starts is own matchmaking business, which is so successful that he nearly marries off his girlfriend to someone else.

programme.title: Night Train to Munich
programme.desc: Classic spy thriller about a Czech scientist and his daughter (James Harcourt, Margaret Lockwood) pursued by Nazis. Rex Harrison, Paul von Hernried, Basil Radford. Caldicott: Naunton Wayne. Dr. Fredericks: Felix Aylmer. Dryton: Wyndham Goldie. (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Lady Vanishes
programme.desc: Vintage Hitchcock about an elderly English governess who disappears from a train, a fact that doesn't particularly concern other passengers except for a young lady she'd befriended and who's become convinced that somthing is amiss. (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Wicked Lady
programme.desc: Margaret Lockwood is a 17th-century aristocrat conniving with James Mason for romance and highway robbery. Sir Ralph: Griffith Jones. Caroline: Patricia Roc. Henrietta: Enid Stamp-Taylor. Kit: Michael Rennie. Hogarth: Felix Aylmer. Martin: David Horne.(n)

programme.title: Deadly Friend
programme.desc: A murdered teen (Kristy Swanson) is revivified with an artificial brain. Directed by horror maven Wes Craven. Paul: Matthew Laborteaux. Jeanne: Anne Twomey. Tom: Michael Sharrett. Harry: Richard Marcus. Elvira: Anne Ramsey. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Swamp Thing
programme.desc: Wes Craven's campy thriller about the outcome of a botched experiment. Louis Jourdan, Adrienne Barbeau. Alec: Ray Wise. Jude: Reggie Batts. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Narcotics Pit of Despair
programme.desc: An educational short that describes the pitfalls of drug use, tracking a student who's lured into the world of narcotics by a shadowy dealer. Kevin Tighe (of TV's "Emergency!") stars in an early role.(n)

programme.title: Make Way for Tomorrow
programme.desc: During the Depression, an elderly couple are left homeless after the bank forecloses on their house, forcing them to move in with their grown children, which proves to be a difficult adjustment. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Captain's Pup
programme.desc: The Captain adopts a puppy, much to his wife's dismay.(n)

programme.title: Let's Sing a Song From the Movies
programme.desc: Audience sing-along features tunes from four musicals with the lyrics appearing on screen. Numbers include "Am I Blue?" from 1929's "On with the Show," "By a Waterfall" from 1933's "Footlight Parade," "Some Sunday Morning" from 1945's "San Antonio" and "A Gal in Calico" from 1946's "The Time, the Place and the Girl." Art Gilmore is the narrator.(n)

programme.title: Take a Cue
programme.desc: Entry in the "Pete Smith Specialty" series featuring billiards instruction from Charles C. Peterson, who also performs some trick shots. Pete Smith is the narrator.(n)

programme.title: Cowboy Cavalier
programme.desc: Crooning cowboy Jimmy Wakely and sidekick Dub Taylor come to the aid of a damsel in distress. Louis Armstrong, Jan Bryant, Steve Clark, Douglas Evans, Carol Henry, Milburn Morante, Bud Osborne, William Ruhl, Claire Whitney. Directed by Derwin Abrahams. (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Saint Strikes Back

programme.title: Nagrywarka
programme.desc: Program, w którym widzowie przesyłają pozdrowienia. Wystarczy, że odnajdą specjalne pudełko i zostawią w nim swoje nagranie. Prowadzący Filip z przemierzy z "nagrywarką" całą Polskę, zawita zarówno do dużych, jak i mniejszych miast. Uczestnicy programu oprócz możliwości nagrania pozdrowień, będą mogli wziąć udział w specjalnych quizach i wygrać nagrody pieniężne.

programme.title: Szybkie strzały
programme.desc: Nietypowa sonda uliczna. Prowadzący zadają napotkanym osobom oryginalne, często wręcz abstrakcyjne pytania. Nieraz potrafią nimi swoich rozmówców mocno zaskoczyć.

programme.title: Ranking Jankesa
programme.desc: Krzysztof "Jankes" Jankowski przedstawia subiektywny ranking tego, co najlepsze w sieci, muzyce, świecie show-biznesu i wszystkich innych interesujących rzeczy, którymi dzieli się z widzami.

programme.title: 10 hitów 1 po 2
programme.desc: Twórcy programu w każdym wydaniu prezentują 10 wybranych hitów. Utwory, będące największymi przebojami najsłynniejszych wykonawców, grane są jeden po drugim.

programme.title: 10 hitów 1 po 2

programme.title: Jazdy Gwiazdy
programme.desc: Gospodarz programu Filip "Rudy" Rudanacja zaprasza do swojego garbusa znane i lubiane gwiazdy show-biznesu. Podczas wspólnej przejażdżki nie zawaha się zapytać swojego gościa o wszystko, na co ma ochotę i co chcieliby usłyszeć widzowie.

programme.title: Będę grał w grę
programme.desc: Magazyn skierowany do miłośników gier komputerowych. Jego autorzy omawiają i testują najnowsze propozycje, które trafiają na rynek.

programme.title: Będę grał w grę
programme.desc: Magazyn skierowany do miłośników gier komputerowych. Jego autorzy omawiają i testują najnowsze propozycje, które trafiają na rynek.

programme.title: Ale PRANK
programme.desc: Mateusz Jędraś przemierza ulice uzbrojony w kamerę, by obserwować reakcje przechodniów na rozmaite zaskakujące sytuacje. Prowadzący sprawdza, kiedy kończy się cierpliwość, empatia oraz wiara we własną pamięć. Zamierza przekroczyć każdą granicę w celu odkrycia prawdziwych, spontanicznych reakcji ludzi, gdy znajdują się w niespodziewanych warunkach.

programme.title: Nagrywarka
programme.desc: Program, w którym widzowie przesyłają pozdrowienia. Wystarczy, że odnajdą specjalne pudełko i zostawią w nim swoje nagranie. Prowadzący Filip z przemierzy z "nagrywarką" całą Polskę, zawita zarówno do dużych, jak i mniejszych miast. Uczestnicy programu oprócz możliwości nagrania pozdrowień, będą mogli wziąć udział w specjalnych quizach i wygrać nagrody pieniężne.(n)

programme.sub-title: Picture Day; Pat No Pay; Blackjack

programme.title: SpongeBob SquarePants
programme.desc: A microscopic submarine is sent into Squidward's body to retrieve the clarinet reed he accidentally swallowed; SpongeBob helps Patrick change his identity after the starfish becomes convinced that he's in danger. (repeat).

programme.title: SpongeBob SquarePants
programme.desc: Patrick needs a role model; SpongeBob creates a “bubble buddy.” Voices include Tom Kenny, Bill Fagerbakke and Rodger Bumpass. (repeat).

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Greg Kinnear guest stars as Charlie's Nobel Prize-winning ex, who wants her back as much as Ross wants the grant he oversees. Meanwhile, nobody wants the homemade painting Phoebe is giving away; and Chandler gets into hot water with Joey by not casting him in his firm's commercial. Charlie: Aisha Tyler. Masco: Ming Lo. (repeat).

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with the Home Study
programme.desc: The Bings' road to adoption hits a bump when their social worker realizes she's been to their place before...as one of Joey's many dates. Meanwhile, Mike and Phoebe struggle over donating their wedding fund to a charity other than themselves. Mike: Paul Rudd. Clerk: Matt Winston. (repeat).

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with the Birth Mother
programme.desc: The Bings head to Ohio to meet the mother (Anna Faris) of a baby they hope to adopt, and end up going to further extremes after she mistakes them for a doctor and a reverend. Back home, Joey has a hard time dating Phoebe's food-picking pal (Annie Parisse). (repeat).

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Chandler Gets Caught
programme.desc: Rachel and Phoebe discover a shocking truth about Chandler after spotting him sneaking around with a mysterious blonde. Meanwhile, the gang looks back on their lives together. Joey: Matt LeBlanc. Phoebe: Lisa Kudrow. (repeat).

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where the Stripper Cries
programme.desc: Danny DeVito pops in as the girls' worst idea for spicing up Phoebe's bachelorette party; Ross and Chandler recall their college days after running into a mutual love at their reunion; Joey ruins a man's chances of winning big on a game show. Donny Osmond appears as himself. (repeat).

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Phoebe and Mike's hopes for a simple wedding are sidelined by Monica's over-the-top plans, an approaching blizzard and Joey's too fatherly interests in the groom's intentions. Meanwhile, Ross and Chandler battle it out for a place in the bridal party. (repeat).

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Joey Speaks French
programme.desc: Phoebe tries to tutor Joey in French for a foreign-film audition, but ends up hating how he mangles the language of love. Meanwhile, the Bings give Erica (Anna Faris) a tour of New York that has Chandler a little too excited about seeing the sights; and Dr. Green's heart attack leads to a pulse-raising face-off for Ross and Rachel. (repeat).

programme.title: Mom
programme.sub-title: Godzilla and a Sprig of Mint
programme.desc: Christy meets her single neighbor (Colin Hanks). Meanwhile, romantic plans for Bonnie and Alvin are foiled by Alvin's ex-wife (Beverly D'Angelo). (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Mom
programme.desc: Christy seeks a new career. Meanwhile, Bonnie and Alvin attempt to recapture their youth. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: George Lopez

programme.title: George Lopez

programme.title: George Lopez
programme.desc: George learns the father who abandoned him is alive, contrary to what his mother had told him. Also, Angie brings home a sick dog. Manny: Esai Morales. Cecelia: Olga Merediz. programme.title: George Lopez
programme.desc: Sandra Bullock reprises her role as “Accident Amy,” a worker who competes with George as both try to sell their kids' fund-raising candy bars. Debbie: Connie Ray. Alberto: Malcolm Wain. Max: Luis Armand Garcia. Carmen: Masiela Lusha. Benny: Belita Moreno. (repeat).

programme.title: George Lopez
